intro: Coreopsis kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange petals and is typically found growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid conditions. Its flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique habitat and striking appearance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
